messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1096
messages.msgSnippet: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1096yeap which is why we just got one harry potter puzzle for Naomi for christmas and it was on sale! I m looking at
messages.messageBody:
Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1096
yeap which is why we just got one harry potter puzzle for Naomi for christmas and it was on sale! I'm looking at buying our games and puzzles at the local goodwill. She likes Harry Potter, but alot of the newer stuff on the market also has to wait...we can only stretch our money just so far each month.
 
Vaughnde Lee
Missoula, Montana
http://www.stampinbookworm.eboard.com
-----Original Message-----
From: Nina Sutcliffe <ninacs@...>
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Date: Friday, April 06, 2001 11:20 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1096


> Message: 13
> Date: Thu, 5 Apr 2001 23:40:28 -0400
> From: "Karen" <careermom@...>
> Subject: Re: Re: financial planning
>
>> In this light, Robert Kiyosaki (of "If you want to be Rich and Happy, don't
>> go to school fame" and "Rich Dad, Poor Dad" and "Cash Flow Quandrant" and
>> most recently "Rich Dad's guide to Investing" fame) has a game that can be
>> order directly from him (or from the Elijah Company (hsing catalog) that
>> exposes kids (and adults!) to important financial principles. His books are
>> great... we're ordering the game for our pleasurable edification...
>
> Went looking for the game.... WOWZA... not an inexpensive game!!!  The kids'
> version was $59.95 at Elijah Co.... he was selling it at his website for
> $39.95.  But the one for ages 10+ was $195 at both places.  Youch.  Right now
> we are just playing "Payday" and we expose our kids to most of our financial
> discussions and decisions.
>
> Karen
> Mama to Emily (12/91), Noah (12/95), Halle (10/98), and Joel (9/00)
> http://www.geocities.com/heartland/2358
> mailto:careermom@...

Yeah - it's not cheap... but neither are the Harry Potter games! (Over Christmas I priced a couple of them at $40ish dollars! I figure that I will learn something new about my relationship to money too, which will make it worth the expense...

Nina

--
